III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
Description procedures that describe the institution’s behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually
and updated as needed. These shall be available to all residents,
their families, and referring agencies.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In Nov 2022, Supervisor 1 and another unidentified male staff
pinned Youth J to the floor with her face down and one arm
behind her back.
In March 2023, Youth J fought with Youth K and was restrained.
The restraint may or may not have been executed properly.
Unidentified staff have grabbed Youth J causing pain to her arms.
Unidentified staff lifted Youth J by her waist and carried her to her
room. On 3-23-23, Youth J and a peer balled their fists and
prepared to fight. Staff used physical force to move the youths to
their rooms. Youth J could not walk.
Investigation This complaint was received on 04/06/2023 and investigated in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist.
Complainant contacted on 04/06/2023, and no additional
information provided.
Telephone contact was made with Consumer Rights Officer on
04/06/2023, he reported Youth J tested positive for Covid and was
in quarantine. A virtual video call requested by DHHS Specialist.
Consumer Rights Officer arranged for Youth J to have access his
computer and scheduled the video call on 04/06/2023.
A Teams Video call completed with Youth J on 04/06/2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth J reported she had
tested positive for covid and was experiencing mild symptoms.
Youth J reported feeling safe at the facility and did not express
any concerns regarding staff or the facility.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer at the facility on04/06/2023,
in collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Consumer Rights Officer
reported Youth J has been at the facility since November 22,
2022, Youth has had 13 incident reports for assaulting other
youths and has been restraint twice since November. The first
2

restraint occurred on 12/09/22 and Youth J was restraint by
Therapist 1 and 2, the second restraint occurred on 03/23/2023
Youth J was restraint by Staff 1 and 2. Staff 2 is currently on
medical leave and will not be available for an in-person interview.
Contact information provided for Staff 2. He said Supervisor 1 was
not involved in any of the restraints involving Youth J.
I interviewed Youth J on 04/13/2023 at the facility, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Youth J reported that she has been
restrained three times since being placed at the facility in
November. She thinks there was one restraint done by Supervisor
1 but could not recall when it occurred or why. She denied being
restraint on the floor and thinks it happened while standing. She
reported the last restraint occurred on 03/23/2023 because she
attempted to hit another youth. She said two staff members put
her hands behind her back in a restraint. Youth J denied having
any injuries or needing to be seen by the nurse after the restraint.
Youth J said staff asked if she wanted to see the nurse after being
restraint and she refused. She also denied staff used physical
force to put her in her room, grab her by the arm, or carry her by
the waist. Youth J reported that sometimes staff play rough with
the youths, but refused to elaborate about which staff play rough
with the youths and said, “no staff in particular.” Youth J reported
feeling safe, getting enough eat, taking her medication, and
receiving therapy.
I interviewed Youth K on 04/13/2023 at the facility, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Youth K has been at the facility for almost
one year. Youth K denied she was grabbed by the arms, picked
up by the waist, or pushed by staff. She further denied witnessing
other Youths being grabbed or picked up the waist. Youth K said
on 03/23/23 Youth J was being verbally and physically aggressive
towards her, and she did not want to fight with Youth J, because
she did not want to get in trouble. She said Youth J tried to punch
her and that’s when staff had to restraint Youth J. Youth K said
staff tried to talk to Youth J before she was restraint, but she
refused to listen to staff. Youth K was moved after the incident and
did not witness what happened after the restraint. Youth K said
she has only been restrained once at the facility it was with her
hands behind her back, she was not injured, and was asked if she
needed to be seen by the nurse after the restraint. Youth K
reported feeling safe at the facility and did not express any
concerns regarding staff or the facility.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 04/13/2023 at the facility, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 has been working at the facility for
3

12 years. She reported on 03/23/23, Youth J returned to the wing
after her therapy and started to argue with Youth K. She said
Youth K was not reacting to Youth J, but Youth J continued to
instigate and go after Youth K. She and Staff 1 tried to verbally de-
escalate Youth J, and block Youth J from Youth k. She said that’s
when Youth J lunged at Youth K and tried to punch Youth K. She
and Staff 2 immediately responded by performing a CPI two
person standing restraint on Youth J. Once Youth J calmed down,
she was released, and she walked to her bedroom. She debriefed
with Youth J after the restraint and Youth J denied being injured or
being in pain. Staff 1 denied staff grab the youths by the arms and
denied seeing any staff pick up the youths around the hip area
from behind and lift the youth off the floor or carry them to their
bedrooms.
I interviewed Therapist 1 on 04/13/2023 at the facility, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Therapist 1 has been working
at the facility for 10 years and is trained in CPI. She performed the
restraint on 12/09/2023 with Youth J. She said Youth J was upset
about being placed at the facility. Youth J went to the gym and
started throwing chairs, flipping tables, and attempted to knock
over a shelf. Therapist 1 followed Youth J tried to verbally de-
escalate Youth J, but Youth J would not calm down. She called for
Therapist 2 to assist, and Youth J was placed in CPI hold. She
said the restraint lasted less than one minute. Youth J was
resisting and when Youth J fell to the floor the restraint released.
Youth J started to cry and was escorted back to her room. Youth J
was not injured and did not request to see the nurse. Therapist 1
denied seeing staff grabbing or picking up youths by the waist and
Youth J has never reported these concerns.
I interviewed Therapist 2 on 04/13/2023 at the facility, in
collaboration with DHHS specialist. Therapist 2 reported she
assisted in the physical management of Youth J on 12/09/2023.
She said Youth J was throwing chairs, flipping tables, and tried to
tip over the shelf. She said therapist 1 tried to verbally de-escalate
Youth J, but when Youth J tried to tip over the shelf, she and
Therapist 1 attempted to restraint Youth J. She said Youth J was
resisting and fell on the floor, so they immediately released the
hold. Youth J was escorted to her room without incident. Therapist
2 denied seeing any of the staff grabbed a youth by the arm or
pick up a youth by the waist.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 04/13/2023 at the facility, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor denied having any
4

direct contact with Youth J. He denied being involved or
witnessing Youth J being restraint. in any restraint involving Youth.
Video Reviewed:
Video dated 03/23/2023 at 5:45 pm. Youth J is seen walking up to
Youth K, appears to be saying something, Staff 2 walks up and
stands between the two youths, Youth J reaches over and
attempts to punch Youth K. Staff 1 and Staff 2 put Youth J in
restraint, each staff is holding Youth J’s arms by the wrist, near
Youth J’s hip area. Both staff appear to be relaxed and not
applying any force during the restraint. The restraint lasts for 4
minutes. Once released Youth J walks off towards her bedroom.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated: 12/09/2022, Youth J was physically
restraint due to physical aggression. Staff involved
Therapist 1 and Therapist 2. Therapist 1 completed therapy
session with Youth J. Youth J was upset about being
placed at the facility. Youth J left the therapy room and ran
to the Gym. Therapist 1 followed Youth J to the Gym. Youth
J started to flip tables, chairs, and attempted to knock over
a shelf. Therapist 1 and 2 initiated a CPI team control
restraint. Youth J dropped to the floor and Youth J was
released from the hold. The restraint lasted 30 seconds.
Youth J reported no injuries.
• Incident report dated: 03/23/2023 Youth J was physically
restraint due to physical and verbal aggression. Youth J
approached Youth K and said, “we can it now. I am tired of
you talking shit.” Youth K said, I am not trying to fight you, I
am focused on going home.” Staff 2 approached Youth J
and tried to use verbal de-escalation techniques, but Youth
J refused to walk away from Youth K and attempted to
punch Youth K. Staff 1 and Staff 2 intervened with CPI
team control physical management technique. Restraint
lasted 4 minutes. Staff 2 debriefed with Youth J and Youth
J reported no injuries.
Analysis The facility is in complaint with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence that staff performed inappropriate restraints, grabbed, or
picked up youth by the waist. Based on documentation, interviews
with Staff, Therapist, and Youth, Staff utilized an approved CPI
hold during the two times that Youth J was restraint.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth J restrained once in Nov 2022, and twice in March 2023
and afterward, was not seen by the nurse.
Investigation Youth J interviewed on 04/13/2023, in collaboration with DHHS
Specialist. Youth J denied injured after being restrained. She
reported staff did ask her if she wants to see the nurse and she
refused because she was not injured.
Youth K reported restrained once at the facility, but was not
injured, and was asked if she needed to be seen by the nurse.
She denied seeing a nurse following her restraint and said that
she had no injuries and did not think she needed to see the nurse.
Staff 1 reported she debriefed with Youth J following the restraint
on 03/23/23 and asked if she had any injuries or needed to see a
nurse and Youth J denied having any injuries and refused to be
seen by the nurse.
Consumer Rights Officer reported Youth J has been restraint
twice since her placement at the facility on November 22, 2023.
He said after a restraint a youth is asked if they are injured or
need to be seen by the nurse, and in both restraints on
12/09/2022 and on 03/23/2023 Youth J denied being injured.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 12/19/2022, Youth J was restraint in a
CPI team control position due to physical aggression by
Therapist 1 and Therapist 2. No injuries reported.
• Incident report dated 03/23/2023, Youth J was restraint in a
CPI team control position due to physical aggression. No
injuries reported.
Analysis Based on the Youth J interview and documentations there is no
evidence that Youth J was injured during the restraints and,
therefore she did need to be examined by the nurse.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(b) The services provided to residents and parents directly by
the institution and the services provided by outside resources.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Program statement - services Youth J was quarantined on 4/4/23
and is prohibited from remote learning.
Investigation Youth J was quarantined for 5 days due to testing positive for
Covid. Youth confirmed she was provided with schoolwork and
other activity books while she was quarantined. Youth J said she
back in school after the 5 days in quarantine.
Therapist 1 reported she provided Youth J with schoolwork,
crossword puzzles, workbooks, and hidden picture books while in
quarantine.
Analysis The facility is not in violation Staff and Youth interviewed
confirmed youth was provided with schoolwork while quarantined
for 5 days and has since returned to school.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4124
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a written policy regarding
Description communication that ensures that a child is able to communicate
with family and friends in a manner appropriate to the child’s
functioning and consistent with the child’s treatment plan and
security level.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth J is not allowed to telephone her foster care worker daily.
Investigation Youth J reported she is allowed to make telephone calls to her
foster care worker and has been speaking to her worker. She said
her only issue was that last week the headset for the telephone
was broken and when she called her worker, she had the phone
on speaker. She said the phone headset has been fixed.
7

Youth K reported she has access to making telephone calls during
telephone hours which is Monday through Friday after school. She
is provided with a private area to speak with her worker and that
all youths are given the same privileges to making telephone calls.
Staff 1 reported all the youths have telephone privileges and are
permitted to speak with their foster care workers privately.
Consumer Rights Officer reported each wing has two telephones
and residents are provided with telephone access to contact
workers, GAL, and relatives.
Document Reviewed:
Youth J’s telephone log for the month of March. Youth J made 38
calls: 12 calls to her worker, 25 calls to her sister, and 2 calls to
her GAL.
Analysis The facility is not in violation based on documentation and
interviews with Staff and Youths confirmed Youth J has access to
making telephone calls.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
